TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @misc{Wiki_szy_balad, title = balad, year = 2025, month = May, day = 5, note = {In Wikipedia [Sakizaya]}, url = {https://szy.wikipedia.org/wiki/balad} }

S.FORM: balad : 洪水 / balad han ku tabakiay a likid nu nanum. nilacul siwkay nu balad u balad sa, u lahad a balasi'. tabaki ku nanum, matumes tu ku sa'wac. paelul tu niyazu' atu tademaw. anu maudad caay kasatezep, mabulad tu. anu tayni ku balius, mabulad tu. matalaw tu balad ku tademaw. mapeci' tu luma' atu nipaluma. tinaku a kamu mabalad 洪水氾濫 / mabalad maenep ku niyazu'. mabaladay 洪水氾濫的 / mabaladay ku niyazu' nu Maibul. u sulit nu Hulam atu Amilika A flood is an overflow of water that submerges land that is usually dry. The European Union Floods Directive defines a flood as a covering by water of land not normally covered by water. In the sense of "flowing water", the word may also be applied to the inflow of the tide.

balad : 洪水 / balad han ko tabakiay a likid no nanom. nilacol siwkay no balad o balad sa, o lahad a balasi'. tabaki ko nanom, matomes to ko sa'wac. paelol to niyazo' ato tademaw. ano maodad caay kasatezep, mabolad to. ano tayni ko balios, mabolad to. matalaw to balad ko tademaw. mapeci' to loma' ato nipaloma. tinako a kamo mabalad 洪水氾濫 / mabalad maenep ko niyazo'. mabaladay 洪水氾濫的 / mabaladay ko niyazo' no Maibol. o solit no Holam ato Amilika A flood is an overflow of water that sobmerges land that is osoally dry. The Eoropean Union Floods Directive defines a flood as a covering by water of land not normally covered by water. In the sense of "flowing water", the word may also be applied to the inflow of the tide.
